info.title: Accounting

description.en:
DATEVconnect supports the integration of DATEV solutions within the on-premise environment.
This enables bidirectional data interchange between DATEV programs and solutions from other software manufacturers. 

This documentation describes REST resources and provides relevant information.
description.de:
DATEVconnect unterstützt die Integration von DATEV-Lösungen in die
On-Premise-Umgebung. Dies ermöglicht einen bidirektionalen Datenaustausch zwischen
DATEV-Programmen und Lösungen anderer Softwarehersteller. Die vorliegende
Dokumentation beschreibt die REST-Ressourcen und stellt entsprechende Informationen
zur Verfügung.

info.x-datev-shortdescription: Ermöglicht einen einfachen bidirektionalen Datentransfer zwischen Drittlösungen und DATEV-Rechnungswesen-Anwendungen.
info.description:
DATEVconnect unterstützt die Integration von DATEV-Lösungen in die
On-Premise-Umgebung. Dies ermöglicht einen bidirektionalen Datenaustausch zwischen
DATEV-Programmen und Lösungen anderer Softwarehersteller. Die vorliegende
Dokumentation beschreibt die REST-Ressourcen und stellt entsprechende Informationen
zur Verfügung.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of clients/companies
get.description:
### **Retrieval of all clients from DATEV Rechnungswesen (Accounting) in the form of a list.**
*[Abruf aller Mandanten aus dem DATEV Rechnungswesen in Form einer Liste.]* **Retrieve clients with company data**
By default, a client without subordinate objects is output. By including the parameter "expand=all" in the URI, the company data (Unternehmensdaten) is included in the results list.

**Using multiple data paths**
- When using multiple data paths, the use of the following header is recommended: - **accept: multipart/mixed, application/json**
- If one or more data paths are not adapted to the current version, an additional message is displayed: - Example: ```json [ { "error":"REW11041", "error_description":"Nicht alle Datenpfade sind auf dem aktuellen Versionsstand. Starten Sie die Datenanpassung im Installations-Manager. Weitere Informationen finden Sie hier: 'http://www.datev.de/hilfe/9215997'", "request_id":"80a2f2ae-dd39-456d-a355-cd6c656194f5", "additional_messages": [ { "id":"REW11041", "description":"Die angeforderten Daten konnten nicht (vollständig) geliefert werden, da nicht alle Datenpfade auf dem aktuellen Versionsstand sind. Starten Sie die Datenanpassung im Installations-Manager. Detaillierte Informationen hierzu finden Sie in Dokument 'https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9215997'.", "severity":"Information" } ] } ] ```

200.description: Clients retrieved successfully within the scope of Rechnungswesen (accounting).

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific client/company
get.description:
### **Retrieval of a specific client/company from DATEV Rechnungswesen (Accounting).**
*[Abruf eines bestimmten Mandanten/Unternehmens aus DATEV Rechnungswesen.]* **Retrieve clients with company data**
By default, a client without subordinate objects is output. By including the parameter "expand=all" in the URI, the company data is included in the results list.

200.description: Client retrieved successfully within the scope of Rechnungswesen (accounting).

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of fiscal years
get.description:
### **Retrieval of the financial years created as part of accounting from DATEV Rechnungswesen (Accounting) including the accounting master data of a client/company in the form of a list.**
*[Abruf der im Rahmen der Buchhaltung angelegten Wirtschaftsjahre aus DATEV Rechnungswesen einschließlich der Buchhaltungsstammdaten eines Mandanten/einer Firma in Form einer Liste.]* **Filter**
It is not possible to filter by the following properties: - advance_turnover_tax_return - legal_form - method_of_determing_net_income - taxation_method

**Using multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637)

200.description: All available fiscal years retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

It is not possible to filter by the following properties: - advance_turnover_tax_return - legal_form - method_of_determing_net_income - taxation_method

**Using multiple data paths**

200.description: The fiscal year {fiscal-year-id} has been retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve an accounts receivable list (uncondensed)
get.description:
##### *Below, the term "Open Items" in upper case will be used as the umbrella term for all entries in accounts payable and receivable. When referring to the concrete status of "Open Items", the term will appear in lower case (e.g. "open items" or "cleared items").* ### **Retrieval of all open and cleared uncondensed items.**
*[Abruf aller offenen und ausgeglichenen, ungerafften Posten.]* **Streaming** *[schrittweise Übertragung großer Datenmengen]*
This resource supports streaming (Header "accept: application/octet-stream").
The number of items may differ from the unstreamed request, as the functional context is missing here.

**Limitations to normal requests:**
- Properties "open_balance_of_item" and "debit_credit_identifier" are not available - Filter on "open_balance_of_item" cannot be applied - Use of paging is not supported - Error messages will not be displayed for the time being

- **Retrieving Open Items with subordinate objects**
By including the parameter **"expand=all"** in the URI, the full scope of an Open Item object will be requested.
The full scope of an Open Item contains the additional information. *Note: From the total amount of all additional information from all account postings created, only the first 10 additional information types can be output. For each open item, the output-able additional information that exists for this item and has a value is output.*
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the Open Item object will be requested without subordinate objects.

**Filter**
If no further parameters are entered, the list contains both open and cleared items.

*Filter options (the number of results can be limited by using the following filters):* - account_number - document_field1 - date - due_date - open_balance_of_item - is_cleared

**Operators**
*Filter option:* - *account_number* - *date* - *due_date* - *open_balance_of_item*
| Operator | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* | | le | Less than or equal *[kleiner als oder gleich]* |
*Filter option:* - *document_field1* - *is_cleared*
| Operator | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* |
**Filter combinations**
Filters can be combined using the operator **"and"**.

**Paging** *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]*
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose.

| Parameter | Description | | ---------- |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of Open Items that should be skipped.
Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of Open Items that should be read as a result of the request.
Example: top=20 |
Please note that the functional connection of the Open Items remains intact.
In some cases, more items may be returned than were filtered by top & skip, since these items belong together.
Paging enables combinations with the filters **"account_number"** and **"is_cleared"**.

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all outstanding accounts receivable:** - .../accounts-receivable?filter=is_cleared eq false - **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all accounts receivable for the debitor with the account number 20000:** - .../accounts-receivable?filter=account_number eq 200000000 - **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all accounts receivable for debitors with account numbers ranging from 20000 to 29999:** - .../accounts-receivable?filter=account_number ge 200000000 and account_number le 299999999 - **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all accounts receivable cleared:** - .../accounts-receivable?filter=is_cleared eq true - **Retrieving of the first 10 accounts receivable:** - .../accounts-receivable?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 accounts receivable:** - .../accounts-receivable?top=10&skip=10"

200.description: Accounts receivable retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is  either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific account receivable (uncondensed)
get.description:
##### *Below, the term "Open Items" in upper case will be used as the umbrella term for all entries in accounts payable and receivable. When referring to the concrete status of "Open Items", the term will appear in lower case (e.g. "open items" or "cleared items").* ### **Targeted access to an individual account receivable using a technical ID.**
*[Gezielter Zugriff auf einen einzelnen Geschäftswert mit Hilfe einer technischen ID.]* Receivables comprise all Open Items entered in accounts receivable. This access request can be used to determine the current status of a specific account receivable from a previously requested list of uncondensed accounts receivable. This access request cannot be used for condensed accounts receivable.

**Retrieving Open Items with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of an Open Item object will be requested.
The full scope of an Open Item contains the additional information. *Note: From the total amount of all additional information from all account postings created, only the first 10 additional information types can be output. For each open item, the output-able additional information that exists for this item and has a value is output.*
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the Open Item object will be requested without subordinate objects.

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving an account receivable:** - .../accounts-receivable/20140101_4711

200.description: A specific account receivable retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve an account postings list
get.description:
### **Retrieve an account postings list for general ledger/subledger accounts for a fiscal year.**
*[Abruf aller Kontobuchungen eines Wirtschaftsjahres.]* Postings with error flags or postings that are flagged as posting proposals are not transferred.

Note: Fee required feature. The required license can be ordered in the DATEV shop.

**Streaming**
This resource supports streaming (Header "accept: application/octet-stream").
The use of streaming is highly recommended as there can be large amounts of data.
About 100.000 account-postings, streaming is absolutely necessary.

**Limitations to normal requests:**
- Error messages will not be displayed for the time being

**Retrieving account postings with subordinate objects**
By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of account postings with any existing additional information, advance payment and open item information will be requested.
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the account postings object will be requested without subordinate objects.

**Filter**
If no further parameters are entered, the list contains its full scope.

*Filter options (the number of results can be limited by using the following filters):*
- account_number - date - accounting_reason

**Operators**
*Filter option:* - *account_number* - *date*
| Operator | Description | | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* | | le | Less than or equal *[kleiner als oder gleich]* |
*Filter option:* - *accounting_reason*
| Operator | Description | | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* |
**Filter combinations**
Filters can be combined using the operator **"and"**.

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving all account postings:** - .../account-postings - **Retrieving all account postings with the account number 20000:** - .../account-postings?filter=account_number eq 200000000 - **Retrieving all account postings with account numbers ranging from 20000 to 29999:** - .../account-postings?filter=account_number ge 200000000 and account_number le 299999999

200.description: Account postings retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

post.description:
### **Transferring an accounting sequence containing accounting records to Rechnungswesen (accounting).**
*[Übertragung eines Buchungsstapels inkl. Buchungssätzen in die Stapelverarbeitung]* Exception: Accounting sequences with the record type annual financial statements are not visible in the product Mittelstand Faktura.

Using this approach, it is possible to process sequences on an individual basis or attach them to an existing (but not yet comitted) sequence.

**Accounting period**
Allocation to an accounting period is performed using "date_from" and "date_to" in the **accounting-sequence** class. It is important to ensure that both dates for the accounting sequence are within a single accounting period.

**Volume limit for accounting sequences**
The maximum number of transaction records that can be written per accounting sequence depends on the infrastructure used by the client (e.g. hardware, network, etc.).

**GoBD finalization of accounting sequences**
The **accounting-sequence** class features an "is_committed" property to enable accounting sequences to be transmitted with TRUE or FALSE values that indicate finalization status. This flag applies with respect to the entire accounting sequence. With delivery of Rechnungswesen version 8.0x (2019): If no finalization flag is transferred, the accounting sequence will be automatically committed after following an import into the DATEV accounting programs.
For more information, please refer to the Info Database, documents [1080636](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080636) and [1080697](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080697).

**Date specification with time zone**
The given time zone in the accounting sequence (for example, addresses and banks, temporary billing blocks) should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred.
As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).
It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: **2024-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00**
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences.
For example: JSON = 2024-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2024) | database = 2024-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2024)
See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

### **Retrieve a list of accounting sequences in the fiscal year.**
*[Abruf einer Liste von Buchungsstapeln im Wirtschaftsjahr]* **Filter**
Filters to condense the scope of the results are not available.

**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]***
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The accounting sequences will be sorted by accounting sequence ID.
| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | skip | Number of accounting sequences that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of accounting sequences that should be read as a result of the request.Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving of the first 10 accounting sequences:** - .../accounting-sequences?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 accounting sequences:** - .../accounting-sequences?top=10&skip=10

*[Abruf einer Liste von Buchungssätzen eines bestimmten Buchungsstapels (Primanota).]* **Retrieving accounting records with subordinate objects**
By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a accounting records object will be requested. In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the accounting records object will be requested without subordinate objects (additional information, advance payment).

**Filter**
Filters to condense the scope of the results are not available.

**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]***
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request.
In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The accounting records will be sorted by accounting record ID.

| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | skip | Number of accounting records that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of accounting records that should be read as a result of the request.Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock.
If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving of the first 10 accounting records:** - .../accounting-records?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 accounting records:** - .../accounting-records?top=10&skip=10

get.summary: Retrieve a list of posting proposal rules for incoming invoices
get.description:
### **Retrieve a list of posting proposal rules for incoming invoices from Rechnungswesen (accounting).**
*[Abruf einer Liste von Lerndatei-Einträgen für Rechnungseingang.]* When posting proposals are generated from electronic documents, these are completed using the posting proposal rules. The information from the document is compared to existing entries from the posting proposal rules. If the posting proposal rule and the information from the electronic document match completely, the system completes the posting proposal with the general ledger account, contra account, posting description and cost fields.

post.summary: Transfer a list of incoming invoice data
post.description:
### **Transferring of incoming invoice data to Rechnungswesen (accounting) which is processed to posting proposals.**
*[Übertragen von Rechnungseingangsdaten, die zu Buchungsvorschlägen verarbeitet werden.]* When posting proposals are generated, the system fills the fields of the posting record using the debitor/creditor master data, the open item balance, the default settings in the program, and the entries in the posting proposal rules.
In case of a protected client or fiscal year, there is no transfer.

**Date specification with time zone**
The given time zone in the incoming invoice data should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred.
As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).
It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: **2024-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00**
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences.
For example: JSON = 2024-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2024) | database = 2024-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2024)
See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of accounting sums and balances
get.description:
### **Retrieve a list of accounting sums and balances as an annual overview.**
*[Abruf einer Summen- und Saldenliste als Jahresübersicht.]* The list of accounting sums and balances is one of the basic evaluations of accounting and contains the list of the posted accounts. The overview shows the development of values per account for the current fiscal year. The opening balance values, the monthly values (without opening balance), the cumulated monthly values and the total balance are displayed.

This evaluation contains current postings and closing entries.

**Filter**
Without further specification of parameters, the list contains the full scope.

**Filter options**
The number of results can be limited by using the following filters:
- account_number

**Operators**
*Filter option: account_number*
| Operator | Description | | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* | | le | Less than or equal *[kleiner als oder gleich]* |
**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]***
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The accounting sums and balances will be sorted by account number.

| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | skip | Number of accounts from the accounting sums and balances list that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of accounts from the accounting sums and balances list that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving of the accounting sums and balances list for account number 10000:** - .../accounting-sums-and-balances?filter=account_number eq 100000000 - **Retrieving the first 10 accounts from the accounting sums and balances list:** - .../accounting-sums-and-balances?top=10 - **Retrieving the next 10 accounts from the accounting sums and balances list:** - .../accounting-sums-and-balances?top=10&skip=10

200.description: The list of sums and balances has been retrieved.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of debitors
get.description:
### **Retrieving debitors as a list**
*[Abruf der Debitorenstammdaten als Liste.]* Debitors are the customers of a company. Together with the creditors, they constitute the business partners of a company.
**Retrieving business partners with subordinate objects**
By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a business partner object will be requested. In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the business partner object will be requested without subordinate objects (bank, address, and communication details).

**Retrieving a delta of business partners, starting from a defined point in time**
Using the filter "date_last_modification", synchronization scenarios can be achieved.
By including the "date_last_modification ge 2017-01-01" filter in the URI, all business partners can be requested who have been modified since the date entered. The "date_last_modification" filter is entered in the format "date-time": YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD
Please note that the milliseconds are ignored during the request, whereas the time zone is relevant.

**Filter**
If no further parameters are entered, the list contains its full scope.

**Filter options**
The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - business_partner_number - caption - date_last_modification

**Operators**
*Filter option: account_number* | Operator | Description | | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* | | le | Less than or equal *[kleiner als oder gleich]* | | startswith | Starts with *[beginnt mit]* | | contains | Contains *[enthält]* |
*Filter option: caption* | Operator | Description | | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | startswith | Starts with *[beginnt mit]* | | contains | Contains *[enthält]* |
*Filter option: business_partner_number* | Operator | Description | | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | | eq | Equal *[gleich]* |
*Filter option: date_last_modification* | Operator | Description | | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* |
**Filter combinations**
Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]***
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The business partners will be sorted by account number. For a consistent result, it is recommended that no new business partners be written during the retrieval process.

| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | skip | Number of business partners that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of business partners that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving the debitor with the account number (account_number) 10000:** - .../debitors?filter=account_number eq 100000000 - **Retrieving the debitors with account numbers ranging from 10000 to 29999:** - .../debitors?filter=account_number ge 100000000 and account_number le 299999999 - **Retrieving debitors that have been modified since a stipulated point in time:** - .../debitors?filter=date_last_modification ge 2024-09-01T12:23:45 - **Retrieving of the first 10 debitors:** - .../debitors?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 debitors:** - .../debitors?top=10&skip=10 - **Retrieving of all debitors with the description beginning with 'Me':** - .../debitors?filter=startswith(caption,'Me')

200.description: A list of debitors has been retrieved.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

put.description:
### **Update or create a list of debitors**
*[Aktualisieren oder Erstellen einer Liste von Debitoren]* A list of debitors can be updated/created using the desired account number (fill the property "id" with the desired account number, the property "account_number" must remain empty). **The list can contain a maximum of 500 business partners.**
**Important:**
In order to create/update a list of business partners, the header "content-type: application/merge-patch+json" has to be submitted with the request. Please note: Debitors of a tax consultant (marked with a "K") are individualized for the client/company when they are updated (marked with a "I").
By transferring a list of business partners, only the business partners whose account number is specified are changed. This means that the existing list is not replaced by the transfer.
*Example: 1, 2, and 3 exist. 1 and 3 are transferred in a list. These are updated, the 2 remains unaffected.* The information of the specified business partners is **overwritten with the PUT command in its entirety**, as known from an individual update.
The PUT command may also be used to create *only one new* business partner with a desired account number.

**GoBD guidelines**
Pursuant to guideline 1 of the principles regarding the proper keeping and retention of books, records, and documents in electronic form and regarding data access (GoBD), changes to the business partner master data (debitors and creditors) will be logged in Rechnungswesen.
A log of all import activities can be retrieved within DATEV Rechnungswesen under: **Bestand | Importieren | Importprotokoll**.

**Date specification with time zone**

get.summary: Retrieve a list of creditors
get.description:
### **Retrieve the creditors of a client/company.**
*[Abruf der Kreditoren eines Mandanten.]* Creditors are the suppliers of a company. Together with the debitors, they constitute the business partners of a company.

**Retrieving business partners with subordinate objects**
By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a business partner object will be requested.In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the business partner object will be requested without subordinate objects (bank, address, and communication details).

**Retrieving a delta of business partners, starting from a defined point in time**
Using the filter "date_last_modification", synchronization scenarios can be achieved.
By including the "ge date_last_modification" filter in the URI, all business partners can be requested who have been modified since the date entered. The "date_last_modification" filter is entered in the format "date-time": YYYY-MM-DDDhh:mm:ss.sTZD
Please note that the milliseconds are ignored during the request, whereas the time zone is relevant.

**Filter**
If no further parameters are entered, the list contains its full scope.

**Filter options**
The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - business_partner_number - caption - date_last_modification

**Operators**
*Filter option: account_number* | Operator | Description | | ---------- |-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* | | le | Less than or equal *[kleiner als oder gleich]* | | startswith | Starts with *[beginnt mit]* | | contains | Contains *[enthält]* |
*Filter option: caption* | Operator | Description | | ---------- |-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal *[gleich]* | | startswith | Starts with *[beginnt mit]* | | contains | Contains *[enthält]* |
*Filter option: business_partner_number* | Operator | Description | | ---------- |-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal *[gleich]* |
*Filter option: date_last_modification* | Operator | Description | | ---------- |-----------------------------------------------------------------| | ge | Greater than or equal *[größer als oder gleich]* |
**Filter combinations**
Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]***
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The business partners will be sorted by account number. For a consistent result, it is recommended that no new business partners be written during the retrieval process.

| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | skip | Number of business partners that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of business partners that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving the creditor with the account number (account_number) 70000:** - .../creditors?filter=account_number eq 700000000 - **Retrieving the creditors with account numbers ranging from 70000 to 89999:** - .../creditors?filter=account_number ge 700000000 and account_number le 899999999 - **Retrieving creditors that have been modified since a stipulated point in time:** - .../creditors?filter=date_last_modification ge 2024-09-01T12:23:45 - **Retrieving of the first 10 creditors:** - .../creditors?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 creditors:** - .../creditors?top=10&skip=10 - **Retrieving of all creditors with the description beginning with 'Me':** - .../creditors?filter=startswith(caption,'Me')

200.description: The list of creditors has been retrieved.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily  not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

*[Aktualisieren oder Erstellen einer Liste von Kreditoren unter Verwendung der gewünschten Kontonummer]* A list of business partners can be updated/created using the desired account number (fill the property "id" with the desired account number, the properties "account_number" must remain empty). **A maximum of 500 business partners can be included in the list.**

**Important:**
In order to create/update a list of business partners, the header "content-type: application/merge-patch+json" has to be submitted with the request.

This means that the existing list is not replaced by the transfer.
Example: 1, 2, and 3 exist. 1 and 3 are transferred in a list. These are updated, the 2 remains unaffected.The information of the specified business partners is overwritten with the PUT command in its entirety, as known from an individual update.

get.description:
### **Retrieve a list of cost accounting records from a specific cost sequence.**
*[Abruf einer Liste von KOST-Bewegungen aus einem bestimmten KOST-Stapel]* The list contains all cost relevant accounting records. Cost accounting records are independent from financial accounting and are processed within cost. They are recorded monthly. A maximum of 99999999 cost accounting records can be created per cost sequence.

**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]*** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The cost accounting records will be sorted by accounting record ID. | Parameter | Description | | ---------- |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of cost accounting records that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of cost accounting records that should be read as a result of the request.Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.

post.summary: Create a cost accounting record in a specific cost sequence
post.description:
### **Create a cost accounting record in a specific cost sequence.**
*[Erzeugen einer KOST-Bewegung in einem bestimmten KOST-Stapel]* The cost accounting record transferred is provided in the already exisiting cost sequence.

**Volume limit for accounting sequences**
The maximum number of transaction records that can be written per accounting sequence depends on the infrastructure used by the client (e.g. hardware, network, etc.).

**Date specification with time zone**
The given time zone in the cost accounting record should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred.
As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).
It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2024-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences.
For example: JSON = 2024-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2024) | database = 2024-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2024)
See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.

- **Retrieving of the first 10 accounting transaction keys:** - .../accounting-transaction-keys?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 accounting transaction keys:** - .../accounting-transaction-keys?top=10&skip=10

get.summary: Retrieve a list of various addresses
get.description:
### **Retrieve the various addresses of a client/company.**
*[Abruf der diversen Adressen für einen Mandant bzw. ein Unternehmen]* With various addresses, you can edit the addresses of various business partners. These are business partners that do not have their own account, but that are managed with other business partners under a single joint account number.

**Retrieving various addresses with subordinate objects**
By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a various address object will be requested. In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the various address object will be requested without subordinate objects (bank, address, and communication details).

**Filter**
Filters to condense the scope of the results are not available.

**Paging *[Aufteilung von großen Datenmengen]***
When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. Various addresses will be sorted by address number.
| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | skip | Number of various addresses that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of various addresses that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 |
**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples**
- **Retrieving of the first 10 various addresses:** - .../various-addresses?top=10 - **Retrieving of the next 10 various addresses:** - .../various-addresses?top=10&skip=10

200.description: A list of various addresses has been retrieved.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

post.description:
### **A new various address will be created with the next available number (various-address-id).**
*[Erzeugen eines neuen Datensatzes "Diverse Adressen" mit der nächsten verfügbaren Nummer.]* With various addresses, you can edit the addresses of various business partners. These are business partners that do not have their own account, but that are managed with other business partners under a single joint account number.

**GoBD guidelines**
Pursuant to guideline 1 of the principles regarding the proper keeping and retention of books, records, and documents in electronic form and regarding data access (GoBD), changes to the business partner master data (various addresses) will be logged in Rechnungswesen.
A log of all import activities can be retrieved within DATEV Rechnungswesen under: **Bestand | Importieren | Importprotokoll**.

**Date specification with time zone**
The given time zone in the various address (for example, addresses and banks, temporary billing blocks) should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred.
As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).
It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2024-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences.
For example: JSON = 2024-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2024) | database = 2024-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2024)
See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

**Use multiple data paths**
It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

account_number.description: (Sach- oder Personenkontonummer) General ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length), required functional field

additional_functions_for_goods_and_servi.description: (Steuersatz/Funktion) Tax rate/function for the goods/services circumstance

additional_information.description: (Zusatzinformationen) Additional information that can be recorded with respect to accounting records; additional information always contains the following components; type and content of information; to use the additional information, both fields are mandatory

assessment_year.description: (Veranlagungsjahr) Assessment year, format YYYY, Open Items information, public sector

assigned_due_date.description: (Zugeordnete Fälligkeit) Assigned due date, Open Items information, public sector

business_partner_bank_position.description: (Geschäftspartnerbank) Business partner bank (numbering) if a specific business partner bank is to be used for a direct debit or bank transfer, only relevant for Open Items

bvv_position.description: Zuordnung einer Position für den Betriebsvermögensvergleich zu einem Buchungssatz, maximum length 1, 1 = Kapitalanpassung, 2 = Entnahme / Ausschüttung lfd. WJ, 3 = Einlage / Kapitalzuführung lfd. WJ, 4 = Übertragung § 6b Rücklage, 5 = Umbuchung (keine Zuordnung), document [9277189](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9277189)

cases_related_to_goods_and_services.description: (Sachverhalt L+L) Cases related to goods/services, as per Sect. 13 b (1) sentence 1, items 1 to 5 UStG"

cash_discount.description: Skonto-Betrag/-Abzug) Cash discount amount/deduction, only permissible with payments

cash_discount_type.description: (Skontotyp) Cash discount type (not specified, purchase of goods, purchase of raw materials and supplies). If this property is transferred, the property "cash_discount" must also be transferred.

circumstance_type.description:
(Sachverhalt) Circumstance type 
(0 = not specified, 
31 = dunning interest, 
40 = dunning fee, 
84 = late payment charges)
The circumstance type is used by the DATEV accounting program to identify items as dunning interest / a dunning fee; for these items, no dunning interest will be calculated, for example, when drawing up payment reminders; only relevant for Open Items

contra_account_number.description: (Gegenkontonummer) Contra account number, general ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length)

currency_code.description: (Währung) 3-character ISO currency code – indicates the currency used for the amount, see Info Database, document [1080170](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080170)

date.description: (Belegdatum) Document date (the year will be ignored)

debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben-Kennzeichen des Umsatzes) Debit/credit identifier for amount, pertains to the account that is specified in the account_number field

delivery_date.description:
(Liefer-/Leistungsdatum) Date of delivery/service provision. The delivery date may not be later than the date in the field date.
Additional information can be found here [https://www.datev.de/go/ratgeber-leistungsdatum](https://www.datev.de/go/ratgeber-leistungsdatum).

differing_taxation_method.description:
(Abweichende Besteuerungsart) Differing taxation method; for entries that are to be processed using a VAT method other than the classification
contained in the client master data (not specified, taxation based on value of services rendered, taxation based on value of actual receipts, taxation based on value of actual receipts input tax deduction at payment (AT only), no vat calculation, lump sum)

document_field1.description: (Belegfeld1 [Rechnungs-/Belegnummer]) Invoice/document number, document field 1 is the key for managing Open Items. In the event of a payment  or credit note, a comparison with Open Items is only performed if the document number is identical to document field 1; allowed characters: numbers 0 ... 9, uppercase letters A ... Z, lowercase letters a ... z, special characters $ & % * + - /

document_field2.description:
(Belegfeld 2) Document field 2, document number or Open Items processing information; allowed characters: digits, upper and lower case letter an the following special characters: $ & % * + -
see also [9211385](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9211385)

document_link.description: (Beleglink) Link to the accounting document that was digitally stored in a document management system (e.g. document storage, DATEV DMS)

document_system.description: (Dokumenten-Management-System) Document management system, program abbreviation for the document management system used, the property "document_system" must be transferred in conjunction with the property "document_link"

eu_tax_rate.description: (EU-Steuersatz Bestimmungsland) EU tax rate for country of destination, only for relevant EU accounting records. Additional for one Stop Shop, see Info Database [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

eu_tax_rate_for_country_of_origin.description: (USt-IdNr Bestimmungsland) VAT ID number for country of destination, composed of a 2-character country code and the 13-digit VAT number (e.g. FR12345678901), see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1080169) and additional for one Stop Shop [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

eu_vat_id.description: (USt-IdNr Bestimmungsland) VAT ID number for country of destination, composed of a 2-character country code and the 13-digit VAT number (e.g. FR12345678901), see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1080169) and additional for one Stop Shop [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

eu_vat_id_for_country_of_origin.description: (USt-IdNr Ursprungsland) VAT ID number for country of origin, composed of a 2-character country code and the 13-digit VAT number (e.g. FR12345678901), see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1080169) additional for one Stop Shop [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

exchange_rate.description: (Fremdwährungskurs) Exchange rate, used with accounting records in a foreign currency, stipulates how the amount stated and transferred in a foreign currency is to be translated into the base currency when a non-EU country is involved"

has_cash_discount_block.description: (Skonto-Sperre) Cash discount block, only permissible in connection with outgoing invoices (accounting records related to debitors)

has_dunning_block.description: (Mahn-/ Zahlsperre) Payment/dunning block, invoice can be excluded from reminders/payment proposal. Only relevant for an invoice entry and a subledger account (open item bookkeeping)

has_interest_block.description: (Zinssperre) Interest block, this field can be used to indicate an interest block; as a result, no interest will be calculated when creating a payment reminder for this item, only relevant for Open Item bookkeeping"

kost1_cost_center_id.description:
(Kostenstelle/-träger 1) Cost center/unit from cost 1.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [9240176](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/9240176)

kost2_cost_center_id.description:
(Kostenstelle/-träger 2) Cost center/unit from cost 2.
Further information is provided in Info Database, document [9240176](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/9240176)

kost_quantity.description:
(Kost-Menge) Cost quantity, the cost quantity field is used to record the value of a cost center's specific reference parameter, this reference parameter can be, for example, kg, g, cm, m or % and is defined in the cost calculation master data.
Attention: When using SKR 14 (agriculture and forestry), this field cannot be used. For this there are the fields quantity and weight.

payment_method.description: (Zahlweise) Payment method (not specified, direct debit, payment reminder, payment), Open Items information, public sector

quantity.description: (Stück) Quantity, can only be submitted when using SKR 14 agriculture and forestry

receivable_type_id.description: (Forderungsart) Receivable type, Open Items information, public sector

sepa_mandate_reference.description: (SEPA-Mandatsreferenz) SEPA mandate reference, an individual mandate identifier assigned by the payment recipient

various_address_id.description: (Diverse Adressnummer) Various address number, only relevant for Open Item bookkeeping

weight.description: (Gewicht) Weight, can only be submitted when using SKR 14 agriculture and forestry

additional_information_type.description: (Zusatzinformation-Art) Additional information always consists of an ‘additional information type’ and ‘additional information content’.

additional_information_content.description: (Zusatzinformation-Inhalt) Additional information always consists of an ‘additional information type’ and ‘additional information content’.

eu_member_state.description:
(EU-Mitgliedstaat) EU member state of the subsequent final invoice, see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080169).
Except Greece: The country code is EL.

caption.description: (Kontobeschriftung) Account caption. This is a compound field, for example, of first name and surname.

legal_entity_type.description: (Adressatentyp) Addressee type (not specified, natural person, legal person)

legal_name.description:
(Unternehmensname) Legal name
Note: For technical reasons, only the first 40 characters of the company name are displayed.

id.description: ID of the subobject address

address_type.description: (Adressart) Address type, if the address type is not indicated, it will be automatically completed based on the transferred fields (street, post office box or postal code), (not specified, street address, post office box address, corporate client address)

is_address_manually_edited.description: (Verwendungskennzeichen) Usage identifier for a manually edited address

post_office_box.description: (Postfach) Post office box, if both a street address and a post office box are indicated, both values will be added to the database; the post office box will be displayed on the business card in the debitor / creditor master data"

postal_code.description: (Postleitzahl) Zip code, depends on the country code. When the property "country_code" is set, the zip code length of the corresponding country is taken into account. When the property "country_code" is not set, the country is taken from the client's national law

street.description: (Straße) Street, if both a street address and a post office box are indicated, both values will be added to the database; the post office box will be displayed on the business card in the debitor / creditor master data"

is_main_post_office_box_address.description: (Hauptpostfachadresse) Main post office box address (set on default if the address type is "post_office_box_address")

is_main_street_address.description: (Hauptstraßenadresse) Main street address (set on default if the address type is "street_address")

id.description: ID of the subobject communication

communication_data_content.description: (Inhalt der Kommunikationsart) Content of the communication type

communication_type.description: (Kommunikationstyp) Communication method (not specified, phone, email, url, fax, other)

is_main_communication_usage_type.description: (Hauptkommunikationsmittel) Main communication usage type, is not allowed with "communication_type" = other

id.description: ID of the subobject bank

bank_account_number.description: (Bankkontonummer) Bank account number. The specified lengths correspond to the German standard and may differ for foreign business partners.

business_partner_bank_position.description: (Geschäftspartnerbank) Business partner bank (numbering), required when a bank is transferred

is_business_partner_bank.description:
(Geschäftspartnerbank) Business partner bank, usage identifier, only a bank account belonging to a debitor/creditor can be labeled as a business partner bank account.
If exactly **one** bank account is specified, the usage identifier is always set to "true".

sepa_mandate_reference.description: (SEPA Mandatsreferenz) SEPA mandate reference, in the "sepa_mandate_reference" field; one mandate reference per bank can be entered for the business partner; in order to be used correctly, SEPA mandate management must include the mandate reference applicable to the authorizing customer

account_statement_text.description: (Kontoauszugstextgruppe) Account statement text group (not specified, account statement text 1, account statement text 2, account statement text 3, account statement text 4, account statement text 5, account statement text 6, account statement text 7, account statement text 8, account statement text 9, no account statement text)

client_bank_position.description: (Mandantenbank) Client bank (numbering), allocation of the saved client bank that should be used for the direct debit with debitors and payments with creditors

currency_management.description: (Währungssteuerung) Currency management (payments in input currency, payments in euro)

direct_debit.description:
(Lastschriften) Direct debit (not specified, SEPA direct debit, SEPA direct debit with multiple invoices, no direct debit with this debitor)
For public sector: permanent direct debit block (not specified, no direct debit with this debitor)

dunning_limit_percent.description: (Mahnlimit Prozent) Dunning limit as a percentage

dunning_period_calculation.description: (Fristberechnung) Dunning period calculation (not specified, calculate dunning period)

dunning_procedure.description:
(Mahnbedingungsform) Dunning procedure (not specified, first dun, second dun, first and second dun, third dun, second and third dun, first second and third dun, no dun)
For public sector: permanent dunning block (not specified, no dun)

language.description: (Sprache) Language (not specified, german, french, english, spanish, italian)

output_destination.description: (Ausgabeziel) Output destination (not specified, print, fax (obsolete), e-mail)

term_of_payment_id.description: (Zahlungsbedingung) Term of payment, a saved term of payment can be assigned to a business partner here

payment_medium.description: (Zahlungsträger) Payment medium (not specified, individual check, collective check, SEPA bank transfer with one invoice, SEPA bank transfer with multiple invoices, no bank transfer)

due_type.description: (Typ) Type of term of payment (due in days, due as period)

cash_discount1_percentage.description: (Skonto-Prozent-Satz) Percentage rate of cash discount 1 if a cash discount is applied

cash_discount2_percentage.description: (Skonto-Prozent-Satz) Percentage rate of cash discount 2 if a cash discount is applied, have to be lower than "cash_discount1_percentage"

cash_discount1_days.description: (Fälligkeitstage für Skonto 1) Due period in days for cash discount 1

cash_discount2_days.description: (Fälligkeitstage für Skonto 2) Due period in days for cash discount 2, have to be greater than "cash_discount1_days" (if cash discount percentage is specified when cash discount 2 is used)

due_in_days.description: (Fälligkeitstage für Skonto 3) Due period in days without discount, have to be greater than "cash_discount1_days" or "cash_discount2_days"

invoice_day_of_month.description: (Höchst mögliches Rechnungsdatum) Latest possible day of the invoice date for this period

related_month.description: (Relativer Monat der Fälligkeit) Relative month of the due date depending on the invoice date (current month, next month, month after next)

day_of_month.description: (Tagesangabe der Fälligkeit) Day of month within the related month "related_month"

id.description: ID comprising the accounting reason and the asset ID

accounting_reason.description: (Bereich) Accounting reason (50: commercial law, 30: tax law, 40: for calculation, 64: ifrs, 11: reserved1, 12: reserved2).

acquisition_date.description: (Anschaffungs- und Herstellungsdatum) Acquisition and manufacturing date

Further information is provided in Info Database, document [9240176](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/9240176)

isin.description: (WKN/ISIN) WKN/ISIN, codes used to identify securities

id.description: ID of the cost system
ID of the cost center(s)/unit(s), alphanumeric without special characters and umlauts, is a mandatory field with PUT and must be completed with the number of the cost center/unit

creation_date.description: (Angelegt am) Created on, not filled by PUT

date_last_modification.description: (Geändert am) Modified on, not filled by PUT

email.description: (E-Mail-Adresse) E-mail address of the person responsible for the cost center

long_name.description: (Langbezeichnung) Long name, longer values will be truncated when using PUT

short_name.description: (Kurzbezeichnung) Short name, longer values will be truncated when using PUT

responsible.description: (Verantwortlicher) Person responsible, longer values will be truncated when using PUT

city.description: (Ort) City, longer values will be truncated when using PUT

street.description: (Straße) Street, longer values will be truncated when using PUT

valid_from.description: (Gültig von) Valid from, only available in the product specifications of Kostenrechnung classic"

valid_to.description: (Gültig bis) Valid to, only available in the product specifications of Kostenrechnung classic

rate.description: (Kostensatz) Cost rate, only available in the product specifications of Kostenrechnung classic

id.description: (Eigenschaftsnummer) Property number, max. 9 properties permissible, only available in the product specifications of Kostenrechnung classic

characteristic_id.description: (Ausprägungsnummer) Version number, only available in the product specifications of Kostenrechnung classic

assessment_year.description: (Veranlagungsjahr) Assessment year, format YYYY, OPOS (Open Items) information, public sector

assigned_due_date.description: (Zugeordnete Fälligkeit) Assigned due date, OPOS (Open Items) information, public sector

circumstance_type.description:
(Sachverhalt) Circumstance (31 = dunning interest, 40 = dunning fee) – the circumstance is used by the DATEV pro accounting program to identify items as dunning interest/a dunning fee; for these items, no dunning interest will be calculated, for example, when drawing up\
payment reminders; only relevant in connection with OPOS (Open Items)"

has_dunning_block.description: (Mahn-/ Zahlsperre) Payment/dunning block, invoice can be excluded from reminders/payment proposal. Only relevant for an invoice entry and a subledger account (open item bookkeeping)

payment_method.description: (Zahlweise) Payment method (not specified, direct debit, payment reminder, payment), Open Items information, public sector"

receivable_type_id.description: (Forderungsart) Receivable type, Open Items information, public sector

various_address_id.description: (Diverse Adresse) Assignment of a various address to this Open Item

id.description: ID of the cost center property, numbers from 1 to 9

description.description: (Bezeichnung) Description of the cost center property

id.description: (Nummer) Number of the cost center property characteristic,maximum length 8

description.description: (Bezeichnung) Description of the cost center property characteristic

amount.description: (Betrag) Amount, technically required field, either amount and/or cost amount is required for processing

cost_center_from.description: (Kostenstelle/-träger Von) Cost center/carrier From (issuing cost center/carrier), alphanumeric without special characters and umlauts, is a mandatory field in the POST and must be filled with the cost center/carrier number"

cost_center_to.description: (Kostenstelle/-träger An) Cost center/carrier To (receiving cost center/carrier, alphanumeric without special characters and umlauts, is a mandatory field in the POST and must be filled with the cost center/carrier number

document_field1.description: (Belegfeld1 [Rechnungs-/Belegnummer]) Invoice/document number, document field 1 is the key for managing Open Items. In the event of a payment  or credit note, a comparison with Open Items is only performed if the document number is identical to document field 1; allowed characters: numbers 0 ... 9, uppercase letters A ... Z, lowercase letters a ... z, special characters $ & % * + - /

document_field2.description:
(Belegfeld 2) Document field 2, document number or Open Items processing information; allowed characters: digits, upper and lower case letter an the following special characters: $ & % * + -
see also [9211385](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9211385)

IBLZ_number.description: (IBLZ-Nummer) IBLZ number, number for additional discharge (IBLZ-E) or debit line (IBLZ-B) in the line structure

kost_quantity.description: (Kost-Menge) Cost amount, in the cost quantity field the value specification for a specific reference quantity for a cost center is entered, technically required field, for processing either amount and/or cost quantity is required"

month.description: (Monat) Month, determines the IBL month, to which the record is assigned in the IBL flow record

id.description: (Nummer) Number of the cost sequence

accounting_reason.description: (Rechnungslegungszweck) Accounting reason (independent from accounting reason, reserved 1, reserved 2, commercial law, tax law, international accounting standards, for calculation)

description.description: (Stapelname) Cost sequence name, longer values will be truncated when using PUT

month.description: (Monat) Month of bookings (JAN-DEZ = 1 - 12 or 13: If a fiscal year does not start on the 1st of the month (e.g. on 15.03.YYYY) then values for a 13th month can occur. These values the occur from the last posted period)

processed_at.description: (Verarbeitet am) Shows when the cost-sequences was processed (system date at the time of processing)

id.description: (Satznummer) Block number

amount.description: (Betrag) Amount, technically required field, either amount and/or cost amount is required for processing; commercial rounding when more than two decimal places

account_number.description: (Sach- oder Personenkontonummer) General ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length)

alternative_cost_center.description: (Kostenstelle/-träger) Alternative cost center, alphanumeric without special characters and umlauts

contra_account_number.description: (Gegenkontonummer) Contra account number, general ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length), contra account is not relevant for cost

cost_center.description: (Kostenstelle/-träger) Cost center, alphanumeric without special characters and umlauts

debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben-Kennzeichen) Debit/credit identifier of the amount/quantity, pertaining to the account

document_field2.description:

kost_quantity.description: (KOST-Menge) Cost quantity, the cost quantity field is used to record the value of a cost center's specific reference parameter, technically required field, either amount and/or cost amount is required for processing; commercial rounding when more than four decimal places

queryParameter_Select.name: select
queryParameter_Select.description: Comma separated list of properties to which the results will then be limited.

queryParameter_Top.name: top
queryParameter_Top.description: States the maximum number of elements that should be contained within the total.

queryParameter_Skip.name: skip
queryParameter_Skip.description: States how many elements in the total number of items should be skipped.

queryParameter_Filter.name: filter
queryParameter_Filter.description: Entering a filter expression influences the number of results.
queryParameter_Filter.example: filter=is_abc eq true and xy_number eq 10000

queryParameter_Expand.name: expand
queryParameter_Expand.description:
Parameter that allows reading a resource with subordinate objects.
When specifying **"all"**, all subordinate objects are loaded (no indication corresponds to **"none"**).

queryParameter_StartAt.name: start-at
queryParameter_StartAt.description: Starting point for the search for the next available account number.

queryParameter_ReferenceDate.name: reference-date
queryParameter_ReferenceDate.description: Request up to a cut-off date. Example: reference date=2015-04-15
